name: Nada Harby Motawea
objective: Experienced Front-End Development Instructor with a passion for empowering students to build real-world web applications. Successfully trained over 400 students in web development fundamentals and advanced topics, fostering their skills through hands-on projects and interactive learning.

education.degree: Bachelor of Computer and Artificial Intelligence (Major in Information Technology)

responsibilities: Conducted intensive training camps on front-end development, covering foundational and advanced topics.
Assisted students in building portfolio-ready projects, ensuring they gained hands-on experience and industry-relevant skills.
Designed and delivered a comprehensive 4-month diploma, teaching HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Bootstrap, React, Redux, and more.
Guided students through the completion of 10 real-world projects, including fully functional websites and applications.
Led and managed web development training camps, mentoring a team of junior instructors.
Delivered interactive workshops, emphasizing the importance of teamwork and collaboration in web development.
Facilitated workshops and training sessions during university-based bootcamps.
Helped students develop a strong foundation in front-end technologies, preparing them for advanced topics.
Worked on several online stores, improving user experiences and ensuring smooth functionality across platforms.
